page.title: 17DUKE OF EDINBURGH AWARD
page.content: The Duke of Edinburgh's award scheme is for young people between the ages of 14 & 25 to test and practise their skills,determination and endurance in a number of varied activities.There are 3 levels of achievement-bronze, silver and gold.At Greenbank High School about 20 girls are involved in the scheme each year.At each level 4 sections have to be completed,a skill, a physical recreation,community service and an expedition-this being the highlight of the scheme.Candidates participate in a weeks summer camp at a remote site with no facilities.The bronze candidates have to walk over 30 miles carrying all their equipment for 2 nights' camping, and the silver have to cover at least 60 miles and spend 4 nights camping in different locations. These awards are presented by Prince Philip at Buckingham Palace.
